properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 3 at 12:50PM AKST until January 4 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will
cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.
Expect wind chills to around 50 below zero.

* WHERE...Western Arctic Coast.

* WHEN...Now to 6 AM Saturday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Low wind chill values will continue through
the night but will begin to moderate Saturday morning as winds
diminish.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind
speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite
and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SATURDAY
